metadata.title: Thursday, 22nd February, 2018
metadata.session: SECOND SESSION OF THE TWELFTH ASSEMBLY

questions.minister: Minister of General Education when the following secondary schools in Lukashya Parliamentary Constituency will be officially opened
parts: (a)    Musa; and
(b)    Ntumpa. 141.    Mr Lufuma (Kabompo) – to ask the Minister of Finance:
(a)    what the total national debt stock was as of September, 2011;
(b)    what the total national debt stock was as of August, 2017;
(c)    of the total external debt stock, how much is attributed to loans from China in both nominal and percentage terms;
(d)    how much interest is paid, per month, on both domestic and external debt; and
(e)    what the debt sustainability ratio was as of August, 2017.

questions.minister: Minister of Housing and Infrastructure Development when construction of staff houses at Namabanga Health Centre in Nangoma Parliamentary Constituency will commence.

parts: (a)    what has caused the delay in paying terminal benefits to retired civil servants; and
(b)    what measures the Government is taking to expedite the process.
(a)    whether the Government has any plans to sell the former NAMBOARD houses in Ndeke Township in Ndola to sitting tenants;
(b)    if so, when the exercise will commence; and
(c)    if there are no such plans, why.

questions.minister: Minister of Youth, Sport and Child Development whether the Government has any plans to support youth sport tournaments in Bwana Mkubwa Parliamentary Constituency.

parts: (a)    whether the Government has any plans to construct a police post at Keezwa Primary School in Nangoma Parliamentary Constituency;
(b)    if so, when the plans will be implemented; and
(c)    if there are no such plans, why.
(a)    whether the Government has any plans to promote fish farming in Chinsali Parliamentary Constituency;
(b)    if so, what the specific plans are;
(c)    when the plans will be implemented; and
(d)    if there are no such plans, why.
(a)    when the livestock restocking programme will be extended to Nyimba Parliamentary Constituency;
(b)    what the total number of livestock earmarked for the programme in 2017 was; and
(c)    what the total cost of the programme was. 149.    Mr P Phiri (Mkaika) – to ask the Minister of Housing and Infrastructure Development:
(a)    when the construction of the Lupande Health Post in Mkaika Parliamentary Constituency will be completed;
(b)    what has caused the delay in completing the works; and
(c)    what the time-frame for the completion of the outstanding work is.
(a)    how the three Eurobonds issued by the Government were utilised, year by year, and sector by sector;
(b)    how much interest is paid on each Eurobond, per year; and
(c)    whether the Eurobonds will be fully repaid when they mature.
(a)    whether the Zambia National Broadcasting Corporation (ZNBC) has a new equity partner;
(b)    if so, what the name of the partner is;
(c)    how many shares, in percentage terms, were allotted to the partner;
(d)    what the value of each share is; and
(e)    what additional value the partner has brought to ZNBC.
(a)    whether the Agricultural Mechanisation Fund has been established;
(b)    if so, which institution is administering the Fund;
(c)    what the criteria for accessing the Fund are; and
(d)    how many farmers, if any, have benefitted from the Fund so far.
(a)    when computers for all the schools in Chinsali Parliamentary Constituency will be procured; and
(b)    what the total cost of procuring the computers is.
(a)    whether the Government has any plans to promote the Chipoma Falls in Chinsali Parliamentary Constituency as a tourist attraction;
(b)    if so, what the specific plans are;
(c)    when the plans will be implemented; and
(d)    if there are no such plans, why.

questions.question_text: Chimwemwe Parliamentary Constituency was as of 31st May, 2017:

parts: (a)    what the national poverty datum line was as of 31st May, 2017; and

(b)    what measures the Government is taking to reduce the levels of poverty in Chimwemwe Parliamentary Constituency. 159.    Mr Mwila (Chimwemwe) – to ask the Minister of Commerce, Trade and Industry what measures the Government has taken to ensure that Zambia becomes a manufacturing hub of Southern Africa. ___________________
